page.title: 03PORKELLIS Crnwll -Population
page.content: With a population of less than 200 PORKELLIS is a typical small Cornish community in decline. With no industry of any size and small family farms providing little prospect of employment it is not surprising that the young people are leaving to find work elsewhere. Even the once strong religious spirit within the community is in decline, with the Church Of England chapel in PORKELLIS having closed. The majority of the population were born in the area, or within a 25Km radius, although a number of the larger cottages and houses have been bought by people not of Cornish origin either as retirement homes or to run as bed and breakfast accomodation.
